entry.title: It Sounds Dumb When Said Out Loud
entry.summary:
Author: crieslikeafool

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,577Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: “How are things going on your side of the world?” The Wolf asked, eyes sharp. Bruce couldn’t see their mouth, covered by a full-face helmet, but it wasn’t hard to imagine their smirk.“I’ve no idea what you are talking about.”“Come on, B,” The Wolf teased, looking straight in front of them. On the other side of the room Superman, Clark, was talking with his hands, expressive and bright.---Or, Bruce has a conversation with an ally and realizes something about himself.

entry.title: who married professor kent?
entry.summary:
Author: thegonekid

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,964Chapters: 5/6Kudos: 449

Summary: Clark KentProfessor in the ENGLISH DEPARTMENTMETROPOLITAN GOTHAM ACADEMY LIT 229Rating: 2/5 "Professor Kent WILL hijack entire lectures to gush about his husband. Doesn’t matter if we’re supposed to be analyzing Shakespeare—suddenly we’re all trapped listening to how ‘incredible’ his husband looked making pancakes. Apparently, love is real and I’m just failing this class because I couldn’t remember what book his husband bought him for their anniversary. Also, he laughs at his own puns. Loudly. All the time. The man is unstoppable. Someone PLEASE tell me who married this menace because I need to know who willingly signed up for this life."Lois Lane, being the investigative journalist she aspires to be, has to unravel the mystery behind her professor's secret husband.

entry.title: The World's Finest Proposal
entry.summary:
Author: dropsof_rain

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,106Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 112

Summary: Clark had spent his whole life straddling two worlds, never fully belonging to either. An alien dressed as a man, an outsider who had no right to something so deeply human as marriage, as forever.   He had told himself a thousand times that Bruce deserved someone ordinary.   And yet.. here stood Bruce Wayne, the man who trusted nothing, who planned for every outcome, who guarded his heart with a fortress of silence— standing before him with a promise he had no obligation to make.   Or, Bruce proposes to Clark (it is not as easy at it seems.. maybe)

entry.title: Half Agony, Half Hope
entry.summary:
Author: watsonandco

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,616Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 74

Summary: “So, you’re, like, dating two women?” “No, no, no! I’m only going out with one, but… there’s a man who I find very enchanting.” This night couldn’t be worse. “I didn’t know you liked men.” Seriously, Bruce? The man of your dreams seems to like everyone but you and the best you can say it’s that. “I didn’t know either. That’s what I needed you.” It was Bruce’s turn to blush. Batman didn’t blush, obviously, it was a matter of say. “Why do you think I like men?” Superman frowned. “You don’t?”   Batman has a crush on his friend Superman, who has a crush on Bruce Wayne but Bruce doesn´t know that and he´s jealous. entry.title: A Lilac Love
entry.summary:
Author: TheBobblehat

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 91,460Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 345

Summary: Sequel to LAVENDER MARRIAGE It's been three months since Clark was shot with a bullet of lavender kryptonite, impressing him with false memories of his marriage to Bruce Wayne. After a tumultuous balancing act between truth, lies, and certain death, Clark is finally free of the kryptonite's influence, but not its after effects. In the aftermath, Clark confessed his true feelings for Bruce, who eventually let his walls down long enough to give dating a shot. Now in the midst of a brand new(ish) relationship, they aim to keep it business as usual for Batman and Superman. But the League is getting suspicious, and when an old face returns under strange circumstances, their delicate relationship may not be able to weather the storm.

entry.summary:
Author: spideyluvs

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,324Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Gotham is drowning in fear, and Batman fights to keep it from falling apart. When Superman follows kryptonite-based weapons from Metropolis to Gotham, their clash of methods sparks tension — and maybe something more. Forced to work together against Lex Luthor and Scarecrow’s deadly hybrid toxin, they discover the line line between vulnerability, trust, and attraction. This line might be the only thing that can save them… and the city.

entry.title: Please Notice Me, Mr. Wayne!
entry.summary:
Author: alohamoron

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,867Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 342

Summary: Clark Kent is a clumsy journalist with a big problem. He has been obsessed with Gotham’s billionaire Bruce Wayne for months, and that obsession is slowly turning into something more like genuine romantic admiration. Determined to get closer, he hatches a plan to have Batman deliver his messages to Bruce Wayne without ever saying a word himself. Of course, nothing goes as planned. Signals get hilariously crossed, schemes backfire, and Clark ends up tangled up in more chaos with Batman while still obsessing over Bruce. He has no idea that Bruce and Batman are actually the same man.

entry.title: The Sun Cares
entry.summary:
Author: GeraldSillu

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,445Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 178

Summary: "In any other circumstance what you're doing now would be... reasonable. But this is based off a hunch. Do you have proof that the Riddler and the penguin are actually planning something together?" Bruce was glaring at him again. He grated his teeth together in contemplation. "I don't have solid proof, but I know-" Superman held up a hand, pausing Bruce mid-sentence. "No, you don't know. You don't know if they have anything planned at all. But what I do know," Clark moved closer to Bruce, step by step. "Is that you have to go to sleep." He loomed over Bruce. "And I'm not asking anymore." or Bruce won't go to sleep, so Clark has to step in.
